intro: Argocoffeopsis subcordata var. claessensii, commonly known as the Madagascar star apple, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that resemble apples, which are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
